snippet: Parasites that take over hosts, effectively turning them into zombies, are far from rare. But only recently have scientists started to work out the sophisticated biochemistry that the parasites use.
abstract: Researchers have long been aware of a wide variety of parasites that can infest and manipulate brains of their hosts, effectively turning them into zombies; recent studies have sought to discover sophisticated biochemistry behind the process, and newest issue of the Journal of Experimental Biology is entirely dedicated to the subject.
lead_paragraph: Parasites that take over hosts, effectively turning them into zombies, are far from rare. But only recently have scientists started to work out the sophisticated biochemistry that the parasites use.

headline.seo: Parasites Use Sophisticated Biochemistry to Take Over Their Hosts
headline.main: How to Control an Army of Zombies
headline.print_headline: How to Manipulate an Army of Zombies
